name: htmlhead
description:
Writes the text specified in the text attribute to the 'head' section of a generated HTML page.
The cfhtmlhead tag can be useful for embedding JavaScript code, or placing other HTML tags such, as
META, LINK, TITLE, or BASE in an HTML page header.

params.name: text
params.description:
The text to add to the 'head' area of an HTML page. Everything inside the quotation marks is
placed in the 'head' section

params.name: force
params.description: if set to true, it works even within a silent block

params.name: variable
params.description: Name of variable to contain the text for htmlhead.

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the snippet that is added, used to ensure that the same snippet will not be added more than once.

params.name: action
params.description:
possible actions are:

- append (default): append text to the HTML head
- read: return the text already set to HTML head
- reset: reset/remove text already set to HTML head
- write: write text to HTML head, overwrite already existing text in HTML head
- flush: writes the buffer in the HTML head to the response stream
